Richard,
Current thinking seems to place the older Hoju guards like that at ca. 6th C, so not quite so old.

Here are some other photos -- the first guard on this page:

http://home.earthlink.net/~jggilbert/oldiron.htm

and this page:

http://home.earthlink.net/~jggilbert/irogane.htm

and then a bunch of them here:

http://home.earthlink.net/~jggilbert/kofun.htm

and here:

http://home.earthlink.net/~jggilbert/kofun2.htm

I should clarify my earlier statement about guards not being mounted on the nakago until early Heian.  I was thinking of large Japanese style plates.  Smaller "tab" type guards were mounted on the nakago earlier.  These seem to be Chinese or Korean style.

Jim


  Sorry all, that was supposed to read 2000 years old

  Rich
